newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Erste says will bid for Creditanstalt.
newsitem.headline: Erste says will bid for Creditanstalt.

text.p: Austria's Die Erste savings bank said on Friday it expects to be able to make "an attractive" offer for the government's stake in Creditanstalt-Bankverein within the deadline set by the government.
Finance Minister Viktor Klima has set the deadline for midnight today.

"The savings board (of Die Erste) expects that it will succeed in meeting the Finance Minister's deadline and submit an attractive offer by the consortium that will meet the conditions of the government," Die Erste said in a statement, without elaborating.

The Austro-Italian-German group of bidders for the state's 70 percent voting stake in flagship bank Creditanstalt includes Austro-Italian insurer EA-Generali, Commerzbank of Germany and Banca Commerciale Italiana. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 531 12 254
